message_1: A rectangular piece of cardboard measuring 20 cm by 30 cm will be made into an open box by cutting out equal squares from each corner and folding up the sides. Find the maximum volume of the box that can be made using this method.
message_2:
Let x be the side length of the square cut from each corner. After cutting out the squares and folding up the sides, the dimensions of the resulting open box will be:

Length: 30 - 2x
Width: 20 - 2x
Height: x

The volume V of the box can be expressed as the product of its length, width, and height:

V(x) = (30 - 2x)(20 - 2x)x

To find the maximum volume, we can find the critical points of the volume function by taking its derivative with respect to x and setting it to zero:

V'(x) = d/dx[(30 - 2x)(20 - 2x)x]

First, expand the volume function:

V(x) = 4x^3 - 100x^2 + 600x

Now, find the derivative:

V'(x) = 12x^2 - 200x + 600

Set V'(x) to zero and solve for x:

0 = 12x^2 - 200x + 600

Divide by 4 to simplify:

0 = 3x^2 - 50x + 150

Factor the quadratic equation:

0 = (3x - 30)(x - 5)

The solutions are x = 10 and x = 5/3. Since x must be less than half of the smallest side (20 cm) to create a box, the valid solution is x = 5/3 cm.

Now, plug this value of x back into the volume function to find the maximum volume:

V(5/3) = (30 - 2(5/3))(20 - 2(5/3))(5/3)
V(5/3) = (80/3)(50/3)(5/3)
V(5/3) = 2000/9 cm³

The maximum volume of the box that can be made using this method is 2000/9 cm³.
